questions.text: A 16 year old female comes to OB GYN OPD with a complaint of no menses. She has never had menses before. On examination she had tanner stage 3 breast development. On the USG, there is no sign of the uterus. Sample is taken for her karyotyping. The karyotype report is shown as follows. Which is the most probable diagnosis for the patient
questions.solution:
The image shows X and Y chromosomes, which is suggestive of male karyotype. A male karyotype with absent uterus with external features of female is suggestive of AIS. androgen insensitivity syndrome

AIS : Female phenotype with male genotype. No mullerian development. Normal breast development.


C. Turners syndrome : patient will have 45 XO. other abnormalities would be short stature, streak gonads, sexual infantilism, SNHL, shield shaped chest, webbed neck, micrognathia, high arched palate, coarctation of aorta, short fourth metacarpal, cubitus valgus, renal abnormalities, autoimmune thyroiditis, diabetes mellitus

D.Klinefelter's syndrome : 45 XY genotype, and will have gynecomastia but will have male phenotype with tall stature and small testes

Reference: D.C. Dutta textbook of gynecology 7/edition, chapter 28, page number:364.

choices.text: The drug of choice for infertility in this patient is clomiphene citrate
The patient is likely to have acne and hair growth on the upper abdomen
TVS needs to be done for the diagnosis of the condition
Rotterdam criteria is useful for the diagnosis of the condition

questions.text: A 28 year old female comes to the OBGYN OPD with a complaint of infrequent menses (once in 2 months) along with difficulty to conceive. On examination her BMI is 30 kg/m2 and the following is seen as a sign on the neck region of her body. Which of the following is an incorrect statement regarding the probable diagnosis ?
questions.solution:
The image shows acanthosis nigricans which is the cutaneous marker of insulin resistance. The patient most likely has PCOS. The points in favor of the condition are obesity, insulin resistance, infrequent menses and difficulty to conceive.

Rotterdams criteria is used to diagnose PCOS. ⅔ should be positive (Option D)

  1. Oligo anovulation (infrequent menses)
  2. Clinical or biochemical signs of hyperandrogenism
  3. Polycystic ovaries

PCOS are diagnosed on TVS. There are at least 20 peripherally arranged follicles in ovaries and ovarian volume is more than 10 ml.(Option C)

The signs of hyperandrogenism include hirsutism and acne(Option B)

The drug of choice for ovulation induction in the patient is letrozole. (not clomiphene citrate)

Reference: D.C. Dutta textbook of gynecology 7/edition, chapter 29, page number: 378.

Methods for carcinoma cervix screening


Reference: D.C. Dutta textbook of gynecology 7/edition, chapter 9, page number: 93.

questions.text: While conducting delivery in primigravida, the head delivered normally but there was difficulty in delivering the shoulder. The shoulder could not be delivered despite 1 min of trial of spontaneous labour. The following maneuvre was performed to deliver the shoulder. Name the maneuvre.
questions.solution:
Maneuvres in obstetrics :

Maneuvre: Ritgens

Use: Normal delivery

Image:

Maneuvre: Burns marshall method

Use: Delivery of aftercoming head in breech

Image:

Maneuvre: mauriceau-smellie- veit maneuver

Use: Delivery of aftercoming head in breech

Image:

Maneuvre: Pinard maneuvre

Use: Delivery if extended legs in breech delivery

Image:

Maneuvre: Mc roberts maneuvre

Use: Delivery in shoulder dystocia

Image:

Reference : D.C. dutta textbook of obstetrics, 9/edition, chapter 26, page number:393

choices.text: Suction evacuation is done for the management of the condition
The ovaries might show large cysts in this patient
Her beta HCG levels are lower than expected for the gestational age
This patient may present with tachycardia, sweating and cold intolerance

questions.text: 23 year old primigravida 12 weeks 2 days pregnancy, presents to the labour room with complain of bleeding per vaginum. On the usg the following is visualised. What is incorrect about the diagnosis ?
questions.solution:
The USG shows a picture of snowstorm appearance suggestive of complete molar pregnancy.

Complete molar pregnancy has no identifiable fetal tissue. The chorionic villi have edematous swelling and diffuse chorionic hyperplasia(Option B). Patient presents with vaginal bleeding in pregnancy. Uterus is larger than period of gestation. The HCG levels are more than the period of gestation. It may be associated with theca lutein cyst in ovaries, hyperemesis and early onset pre eclampsia. Due to high HCG levels, features of hyperthyroidism like tachycardia, sweating and cold intolerance also seen.(Option D)

If fertility is not desired then hysterectomy is done. If fertility is desired then suction evacuation is the management of choice.(Option A)

Anti D is given if the mother is Rh negative and father is Rh positive.

Reference: D.C. dutta textbook of obstetrics, 9/edition, chapter 16, page number: 180

questions.text: What is the content of the following IUD and what is the quantity ?
questions.solution:
The device is LNG IUS (levonorgestrel intra uterine device). It has poly-dimethyl-siloxane around the stem as a steroid reservoir. The LNG amount is 52 mg which is released at the rate of 20 mcg/day.

Reference: D.C. Dutta textbook of gynecology 7/edition, chapter 30, page number: 392.

questions.text: A 22 year old G2POA1 woman presents to casualty with complaints of amenorrhoea since 2 months, acute abdominal pain & slight bleeding. On per vaginal examination, cervical motion tenderness was classically found. UPT was done & found to be positive. Urgent USG was ordered for & showed the following pattern on Doppler. Which is the most likely diagnosis in this case?
questions.solution:
OPTION B: The classic triad of ectopic pregnancy is delayed menstruation, pain, and vaginal bleeding or spotting. Placental blood flow within the periphery of the complex adnexal mass-the ring of fire-can be seen with transvaginal color Doppler imaging (as shown in the figure).

OPTION A: While acute PID can cause abdominal pain, cervical motion tenderness, and vaginal bleeding, it would not typically present with a positive urine pregnancy test (UPT). Additionally, the "ring of fire" pattern is not a feature of PID; this pattern indicates increased blood flow around an ectopic gestational sac.

OPTION C: Pregnancy of unknown location: This term is used when a pregnancy is confirmed (positive UPT) but the location is not yet determined. But since the G-sac is localized and the "ring of fire" pattern on Doppler is present, it is more specific to ectopic pregnancy.

OPTION D: Dermoid cyst is a type of ovarian cyst that can contain various types of tissues from all 3 germ layers. It is not typically associated with the "ring of fire" pattern or with the acute symptoms described.

Reference: Williams Obstetrics 26th edition, Page number. 583-584

choices.text: Pre eclampsia is an important cause of the condition
There is release of thromboplastin that causes uterine contractions
It is the most common cause of DIC in obstetrics
The patient presents with painless and cause less bleeding

questions.text: LSCS was done for primigravida with 38 weeks pregnancy for non reassuring fetal heart. Intra operatively the following finding was noted. What is not true about the obstetric condition?
questions.solution:
Painless and cause less bleeding is feature of placenta previa

Abruptio placenta

Defined as antepartum hemorrhage occurring due to abrupt(premature separation of placenta from placental bed).

Important risk factors : P/H/O abruptio placenta, increased maternal age, pre eclampsia, external trauma, rupture of membrane in polyhydramnios(sudden decompression of uterus)

Decidual bleeding leads to release of thromboplastin which induces uterine contractions(Option B)

Clinical features :

  1. Uterine contractions present
  2. Bleeding per vaginum
  3. Uterus tense, tender.
  4. Uterus more than gestational age if hemorrhage is concealed
  5. Hypertension
  6. Fetal distress or IUFD

Management : terminate the pregnancy

  1. If vaginal delivery imminent in 4 hours → vaginal delivery
  2. If delivery not imminent → deliver by emergency LSCS
  3. Maternal compromise or fetal distress → emergency LSCS

Complication : DIC, maternal death, fetal death.

Couvellaire uterus : blood exsanguinates into the myometrium and serosa of uterus leading to couvellaire uterus. The uterus is at high risk of atonic PPH. there may be requirement of obstetric hysterectomy

Reference: D.C. dutta textbook of obstetrics, 9/edition, chapter 19, page number: 241

questions.text: A 30 year old female came to the gynecology OPD with a complaint of whitish discharge per vaginum. Swab was taken for the same. A smear of the discharge was taken for microscopic examination which showed the following. Identify the drug of choice for this infection
questions.solution:
The image shows clue cells which are seen in bacterial vaginosis.

Causes of vaginal discharge :


Reference: D.C. Dutta textbook of gynecology 7/edition, chapter 12, page number:124.

choices.text: Wait and watch for 1 year for spontaneous conception
Clomiphene citrate is given for ovulation

questions.text: A 26 year old female came to gynecology opd with a complaint of secondary infertility. She has had a past history of abortion at 3 months of gestation followed by dilatation and curettage, she does not have any live issues. HSG was ordered for the patient and the following was seen. What is true for the management of this condition?
questions.solution:
The diagnosis is Ashermann syndrome

  • First described by Joseph Ashermann as amenorrhea traumatica
  • Amenorrhea due to intrauterine synechiae formation
  • M/C/C is curettage in post partum period (surgical abortion)
  • Other causes : C section, myomectomy genital tuberculosis

Genital tuberculosis is cause of ashermann syndrome if there is no history of abortions in past

  • Clinical feature : amenorrhea or hypomenorrhea with infertility
  • Investigation : cobweb appearance in HSG, saline infusion sonography
  • Management : hysteroscopic adhesiolysis with pediatric foley's catheter placement intrauterine

Reference: Dutta's textbook of Gynaecology, 8th edition, chapter 19, Page number: 220

questions.text: Identify the following type of placenta:
questions.solution:
Option A: Battledore placenta: Umbilical cord at the edge of the placenta.

Option B: Velamentous insertion of cord: Cord inserts into fetal membranes.

Option C: Circumvallate placenta: Abnormal ring of placental tissue.

Option D: Succenturiate placenta: Accessory lobe of placenta separate from the main mass.

Refer to the figures:

Type: Must know

Topic: Abnormalities of placenta

Reference: DC Dutta Obstetrics 9th edition, Chapter 17, Multiple Pregnancy, Amniotic Fluid Disorders, Abnormalities of Placenta and Cord, Page number. 252

choices.text: It is caused by folic acid deficiency in mother
It can lead to oligohydramnios in the pregnancy
It can be diagnosed as early as 10 weeks of gestation
Termination of pregnancy is the management of choice

questions.text: On 12 week scan in a 30 year of second gravida, the following sign was noted while imaging the cranial anatomy. Which of the following is not true about the condition?
questions.solution:
The sign is frog eye sign and is suggestive of anencephaly. Anencephaly is a neural tube defect

There is absence of cranial vault and cerebral hemisphere

It can be due to folic acid deficiency in the mother during pregnancy(Option A)

Complication : Polyhydramnios, face presentation, shoulder dystocia, obstructed labour

Diagnosis is USG : mickey mouse sign, frog eye sign, absence of cranial vault

At 14 weeks the accuracy of diagnosis is 100 %,can be diagnosed as early as 10 weeks(Option C)

Due to it being NTD, the maternal serum AFP levels are elevated

Management : Termination of pregnancy irrespective of age(Option D)

Reference: D.C. dutta textbook of obstetrics, 9/edition, chapter 41, page number: 601

choices.text: Dyspareunia is a common complaint of the patient
Laparoscopy is the investigation of choice
GnRH agonist as well as antagonist are used in the treatment of the condition
Uterosacral ligaments are the most common site for the manifestation of the disease

questions.text: A 23 year old female comes to gynecology OPD with primary infertility. She has regular menses but there is unbearable pain associated with menses. The patient also complains of painful passage of stools. Later on in the course of treatment, laparoscopy was done for the patient. Following is the image. What is incorrect about the diagnosis of the patient?
questions.solution:
Endometriosis

  • Functional endometriotic tissue present outside the uterus.
  • Common sites : ovary, cul de sac, uterosacral ligaments, broad ligament, fallopian tubes, rectosigmoid colon
  • MC site : ovary → chocolate cyst → endometrioma
  • Clinical feature : triad → infertility, dysmenorrhea and dyspareunia. (Option A)
  • Diagnosis : USG
  • IOC : laparoscopy(Option B)
    1. Powder burn lesions, red lesions, blue cystic areas, puckering and fibrosis seen on peritoneum.
    2. Ovarian mass in form of endometrioma
    3. Scarring and adhesions

Laparoscopic classification is done using ASRM criteria

  • Management of endometriosis

Laparoscopy is diagnostic as well as therapeutic

Androgenic drugs - danazol

GnRH agonist - leuprolide, nafarelin

GnRH antagonists(Option C)

Combined oral contraceptives

Gestrinone

Mifepristone

Infertility is managed by ovulation induction with clomiphene citrate. If there is failure even after three cycles then IVF and ICSI are used for management.

For severe disease, IVF is used directly for infertility

Reference: D.C. Dutta textbook of gynecology 7/edition, chapter 22, page number: 250.

choices.text: It is monochorionic pregnancy because of twin peak sign
It is dichorionic pregnancy because of T sign
It is monochorionic pregnancy because of T sign
It is dichorionic pregnancy because of twin peak sign
